author: g11tech
content: it seems like its not scheduling shanghai/sharding hfs

author: g11tech
content: here is the corresponding geth genesis config

author: inphi
content: We're using block times to schedule hfs. The geth config should use `shanghaiTime` and `shardingForkTime` instead.

author: g11tech
content: ok, let me try with that

author: g11tech
content: getting this: I am assuming sharding is on V3 endpoints now? i think we missed that change

author: inphi
content: yeah it's on the V3 endpoints. We recently updated the blob extension PR to do this - https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/ff95a01d34bcf4e0fb945baffc135271d84611c5/src/engine/blob-extension.md

author: tersec
content: for EIP4844 fork choice spec tests, the starting states have `forks` of `previous_version: 02000000, current_version: 04000000, epoch: 0)` -- is this intentional? it doesn't match what would happen in an actual network, and Nimbus sanity checks this

author: tersec
content: and https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/issues/2902 was never fixed and basically no one cared, so that configuration doesn't even make sense

author: __flcl
content: Sure just set all FORK EPOCH values here

author: realbigsean
content:
We got a lighthouse and geth local testnet working on this branch https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/3783. If anyone’s interested in trying it out, there’s some instructions on that PR, let me know if there are issues. It starts post-merge, and spawns a few lighthouse and geth pairs via a bunch of bash scripts. 

I’m interested in trying out any other EL’s that are ready (I think nethermind said they were ready on the last call?).

We’ll be working on porting this over to the interop repo so we can more easily test with other clients. On the last 4844 call it sounded like we wanted the interop repo to start post-merge ? If people are ok with that I’m happy to help work on that as well

author: inphi
content: I'm up for interop post merge only if all clients can support it. It's murky to me which clients can.
